org.jboss.gravia.runtime

Class ModuleEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • org.jboss.gravia.runtime.ModuleEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ModuleEvent
extends EventObject
    An event from the Runtime describing a module lifecycle change.

    ModuleEvent objects are delivered to SynchronousModuleListeners and ModuleListeners when a change occurs in a module's lifecycle. A type code is used to identify the event type for future extendability.

    Since:
    27-Sep-2013
    Author:
    thomas.diesler@jboss.com
    See Also:
    ModuleListener, SynchronousModuleListener, Serialized Form
    Thread Safety: Immutable

    • Field Detail

      • INSTALLED

        public static final int INSTALLED
        The module has been installed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STARTED

        public static final int STARTED
        The module has been started.

        The module's ModuleActivator start method has been executed if the module has a module activator class.

        See Also:
        Module.start(), Constant Field Values

      • STOPPED

        public static final int STOPPED
        The module has been stopped.

        The module's ModuleActivator stop method has been executed if the module has a module activator class.

        See Also:
        Module.stop(), Constant Field Values

      • UNINSTALLED

        public static final int UNINSTALLED
        The module has been uninstalled.
        See Also:
        Module.uninstall(), Constant Field Values

      • RESOLVED

        public static final int RESOLVED
        The module has been resolved.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STARTING

        public static final int STARTING
        The module is about to be activated.

        The module's ModuleActivator start method is about to be called if the module has a module activator class. This event is only delivered to SynchronousModuleListener s. It is not delivered to ModuleListeners.

        See Also:
        Module.start(), Constant Field Values

      • STOPPING

        public static final int STOPPING
        The module is about to deactivated.

        The module's ModuleActivator stop method is about to be called if the module has a module activator class. This event is only delivered to SynchronousModuleListener s. It is not delivered to ModuleListeners.

        See Also:
        Module.stop(), Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModuleEvent

        public ModuleEvent(int type,
           Module module)
        Creates a module event of the specified type.
        Parameters:
        type - The event type.
        module - The module which had a lifecycle change. This module is used as the origin of the event.

    • Method Detail

      • getModule

        public Module getModule()
        Returns the module which had a lifecycle change. This module is the source of the event.
        Returns:
        The module that had a change occur in its lifecycle.

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Returns the type of lifecyle event. The type values are:
        • INSTALLED
        • RESOLVED
        • STARTING
        • STARTED
        • STOPPING
        • STOPPED
        • UNINSTALLED
        Returns:
        The type of lifecycle event.
